title: Login failed
creator: santamonica1
content:
I have 4 mail accounts with the same mail provider and I use Thunderbird to access them. Since a few days I get a login failure for one of the accounts. The other 3 work fine. I have not changed anything myself. The error message reads: "Login to server mailin.telia.com with username santamonica@telia.com failed." Below that message there are 3 options; "Retry" "Enter New Password" "Cancel". Retry doesn´t work and when I click on "Enter New Password" I get a frame with the following message: "Enter your password fpr santamonica@telia.com on mailin.telia.com". I enter my password but it still doesn´t work, I only get the initial error message again.

I have talked to the mail provider and they say that they can´t help with this since the fault is with Thunderbird.

Does anyone have a clue as to what could be wrong, and what I could do to correct this matter?

title: Problème d'affichage de caractères dans Thunderbird
creator: toto23_xbox
content:
Bonjour,

Je rencontre un problème avec Thunderbird concernant l’affichage des caractères spéciaux (accents notamment).

Lors de la réception ou de l’envoi de mails générés depuis un logiciel tiers (Orisha G8), certains caractères accentués apparaissent remplacés par des symboles « ? ».

Par exemple :

« Facture n° 1007035 » devient « Facture n� 1007035 » « compliqué » devient « compliqu� » « écoute » devient « �coute »

Ce problème ne se produisait pas auparavant sur mon ancien PC sous Windows 10. Il est apparu depuis l’installation sur un nouveau PC.

Je suppose qu’il s’agit d’un paramétrage d’encodage (UTF-8 / ISO-8859-1), mais je n’ai pas trouvé de solution dans les réglages de Thunderbird.

Auriez-vous une solution ou une piste pour corriger ce souci ?

Merci d’avance pour votre aide.

Cordialement,

title: view pdf while composing
creator: p.j.m.smulders
content: when trying to view pdf attachment while composing a thunderbird message a mysterious error message appears: "could not be opened, because the associated helper application does not exist. Change the association in your preferences". I found the solution in a reddit forum namely in configeditor of thunderbird change "pdfjs.disabled" to "true". Fine, but why does thunderbird support not give a solution?. And why is the error message so uninformative? it does not say which helper application it is looking for, and what is meant by "association in your preferences" and how to change that. SEE https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/qrpmnb/cant_open_attachments_while_composing/

title: Some local folders are missing after Thunderbird update 10 143
creator: erinbeamer
content: I recently noticed that some of my local folders are missing. Not all of them, but some of them. Following some advice we found in the forums, we closed Thunderbird and then deleted the .MSF files from the Local Folder. When we restarted TB, we had more of the local folders, but were still missing 18 of them in the alphabetical order they are listed in. I created a new profile and copied the local folders over to the new profile. When I started TB using the new profile, there were fewer local folder listed than before. Went back to the previous profile and had the local folders that were still missing 18 folders. I see that there maybe a bug for this being researched as I saw 4 other posts in the forums regarding this recent problem and wanted to get my problem noted also. Thank you.
